title: Tesla Announces $25,000 Compact EV, 'Model 2', for 2027
description: Elon Musk confirmed Tesla (TSLA) is on track to produce its $25,000 next-generation vehicle, internally dubbed 'Model 2', with production starting in late 2027.

title: Amazon Pharmacy Expands to Canada and UK Markets
description: Amazon (AMZN) is expanding its online pharmacy service to Canada and the United Kingdom, intensifying competition with local drugstore chains.

title: PayPal Partners with TikTok for In-App Shopping Checkout
description: PayPal (PYPL) has inked a deal with TikTok to become a preferred payment processor for its new 'Shop' feature, allowing seamless in-app purchases.

title: Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC) Discount Narrows to 5%
description: The discount on Grayscale's Bitcoin Trust (GBTC) has narrowed to its lowest point in three years, signaling strong investor optimism about a potential ETF conversion.

title: US Services Sector PMI Hits 12-Month High, Beating Forecasts
description: The ISM Services PMI unexpectedly rose to 55.2 in October, indicating robust growth in the services sector and complicating the Fed's inflation fight.

title: Threads App Launches Desktop Version and Advanced Search
description: Meta (META) is rolling out a full-featured desktop web app for its X competitor, Threads, along with advanced search capabilities, in a bid to retain users.

title: Netflix Developing 'Stranger Things' Cinematic Universe
description: Netflix (NFLX) executives confirmed they are in active development on multiple spin-off series and a feature film to create a 'Stranger Things' cinematic universe.

title: Disney (DIS) Stock Jumps as Bob Iger Announces Major Theme Park Expansion
description: Disney CEO Bob Iger unveiled a $60 billion, 10-year plan to expand its theme parks and cruise line, causing (DIS) stock to jump 5%.

title: Google Faces New $1.7B Fine from EU Over Ad-Tech Practices
description: Google (GOOGL) has been hit with a â‚¬1.7 billion fine by EU antitrust regulators, who found the company abused its dominant position in online advertising technology.

title: Uniswap (UNI) v4 Codebase is Finalized, Audit Begins
description: Uniswap Labs announced that the code for its v4 protocol is complete and has been sent to several top auditing firms, paving the way for a 2026 launch.

title: Microsoft's GitHub Introduces 'Co-pilot for Enterprise'
description: Microsoft (MSFT) launched GitHub Co-pilot for Enterprise, a new tier that allows companies to train the AI on their own private codebases for $39/user/month.

title: Apple (AAPL) Acquires AI Health Startup for $300M
description: Apple has quietly acquired 'HealthAI', a startup specializing in predictive health diagnostics using AI, for a reported $300 million.

title: NVIDIA H200 GPU Begins Shipping, Sold Out for Six Months
description: NVIDIA (NVDA) confirmed its next-generation H200 AI GPU has begun shipping to major cloud providers, with the entire supply already sold out for the next two quarters.

title: Producer Price Index (PPI) Comes in Cooler Than Expected
description: The PPI for final demand rose only 0.1% in October, lower than the 0.3% expected, providing a positive sign for the Fed's inflation battle. Stock futures (SPY) ticked up.

title: Tesla Deploys First 'Tesla Bot' Units in Fremont Factory
description: Elon Musk tweeted a video of five 'Optimus' robots performing simple tasks on the Fremont factory line, marking the first deployment of the 'Tesla Bot' (TSLA).

title: Google DeepMind's 'AlphaFold 3' Predicts Protein Interactions
description: DeepMind (GOOGL) has unveiled AlphaFold 3, a new AI model that can accurately predict the structure and interactions of proteins, DNA, and RNA.

title: AMD's Lisa Su Confirms 'Zen 6' Architecture is On Track for 2026
description: In an interview, AMD (AMD) CEO Dr. Lisa Su confirmed that the 'Zen 6' CPU architecture development is on schedule for a 2026 release.

title: El Salvador to Issue Second 'Volcano Bond' to Fund AI Mining
description: President Nayib Bukele announced El Salvador will issue a new $1 billion 'Volcano Bond' on the Bitfinex exchange to fund geothermal-powered Bitcoin mining and AI compute.

title: Amazon Q3 Earnings: $1.1B Loss on Rivian (RIVN) Stake
description: Amazon (AMZN) reported a $1.1 billion non-operating loss in its Q3 earnings, attributed to the falling stock price of EV maker Rivian (RIVN), in which it holds a large stake.

title: Salesforce (CRM) to Acquire Mulesoft Competitor for $4B
description: Salesforce (CRM) announced it is acquiring 'IntegrationFlow', a data integration platform and Mulesoft competitor, for $4 billion in cash and stock.

title: Tesla (TSLA) Shanghai Gigafactory Output Hits New Record
description: Tesla's Giga Shanghai produced over 100,000 vehicles last month, a new all-time record, as factory upgrades boost production capacity.

title: Meta to Partner with LG for Next-Gen Quest Pro Headset
description: A report from South Korea claims Meta (META) has partnered with LG Electronics to co-develop and manufacture the 'Meta Quest Pro 2', slated for 2027.

title: Oil Prices Tumble 5% as OPEC+ Fails to Agree on Deeper Cuts
description: Crude oil (WTI) prices fell 5% after the OPEC+ meeting concluded with no agreement on new production cuts, sparking fears of a global supply glut.

title: Intel (INTC) Unveils 'Gaudi 3' AI Accelerator, Claims 2x Performance of H100
description: Intel (INTC) officially launched its 'Gaudi 3' AI chip, claiming it offers twice the performance and 40% better power efficiency than NVIDIA's H100 GPU.

title: Google's (GOOGL) Wing Drone Delivery Service Approved for Dallas-Fort Worth
description: Alphabet's drone delivery unit, Wing, has received FAA approval to begin commercial delivery operations in the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex.

title: Apple (AAPL) Announces March Event for New iPads and M4 Chip
description: Apple has sent out press invites for a March keynote event, where it's expected to unveil new iPad Pro and iPad Air models powered by the new M4 chip.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Considering Acquisition of Cloud Security Firm 'SentinelOne'
description: Microsoft is in early-stage talks to acquire cybersecurity firm SentinelOne (S), according to sources, in a deal that could be valued at over $15 billion.

title: Amazon (AMZN) Ad Revenue Grows 30% Year-Over-Year, Beating Expectations
description: Amazon's Q3 earnings report shows its advertising division is a key profit driver, with revenue growing 30% YoY, far outpacing Google and Meta.

title: NVIDIA (NVDA) Stock Splits 4-for-1, Shares Rise
description: NVIDIA announced a 4-for-1 stock split, effective next month, to make its shares more accessible to employees and investors. The stock rose 3% on the news.

title: Coinbase (COIN) Sues SEC, Demanding Clarity on Staking Rules
description: Coinbase (COIN) has filed a lawsuit against the SEC, demanding the agency provide clear rules and guidance on whether crypto staking services are considered securities.

title: US New Home Sales Plunge to Lowest Level Since 2022
description: Sales of new U.S. single-family homes dropped 10% in October as high mortgage rates and soaring prices sideline potential buyers.

title: Tesla (TSLA) Loses 'Top Safety Pick' Rating on IIHS Test Changes
description: Tesla's Model Y lost its 'Top Safety Pick+' award from the IIHS after the agency implemented stricter side-impact and pedestrian safety tests.

title: Google (GOOGL) Fitbit Division to be Rebranded as 'Google Fit'
description: Google is phasing out the Fitbit brand name. Future hardware will be branded 'Google Fit', and the division is being more tightly integrated with the Pixel team.

title: Meta (META) Releases 'Llama 3' Open Source AI Model
description: Meta has released Llama 3, its next-generation open-source large language model, which it claims outperforms other open models and competes with OpenAI's GPT-4.

title: Netflix (NFLX) Secures Rights to Stream NFL Christmas Day Games
description: Netflix has signed a three-year deal with the NFL to exclusively stream two Christmas Day games, marking its most significant move into live sports.

title: AMD (AMD) Partners with Samsung for Next-Gen Exynos Chips
description: AMD has extended its partnership with Samsung to provide its RDNA graphics technology for Samsung's next-generation Exynos mobile processors.

title: Intel (INTC) Begins High-Volume 18A Chip Production in Arizona
description: Intel has officially started high-volume manufacturing on its 18A process node at its Arizona fab, a key milestone in its turnaround plan.

title: SEC Fines NFT Project 'Bored Ape Yacht Club' (Yuga Labs) for Unregistered Securities
description: The SEC has fined Yuga Labs $5 million, settling charges that its sale of 'Bored Ape Yacht Club' NFTs and 'ApeCoin' constituted an unregistered securities offering.

title: Apple (AAPL) Services Revenue Hits New All-Time High in Q4
description: Apple's Q4 earnings were buoyed by its Services division (App Store, iCloud, Apple Music), which posted a new all-time quarterly revenue record of $25.1B.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A) Sells Entire Stake in HP (HPQ)
description: Quarterly filings reveal Berkshire Hathaway has sold its entire position in HP (HPQ), exiting a stake that was worth over $3 billion.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) to Build $10B 'Stargate' AI Supercomputer with OpenAI
description: Microsoft and OpenAI are planning a $10 billion data center project, codenamed 'Stargate', to house a massive AI supercomputer for training next-gen models.

title: Tesla (TSLA) Faces Class-Action Lawsuit Over 'Phantom Braking'
description: A new class-action lawsuit has been filed against Tesla, alleging the company knowingly sold cars with defective Autopilot systems that engage in 'phantom braking'.

title: Google (GOOGL) Suspends AI Image Generation of People After Bias Complaints
description: Google has temporarily suspended the ability for its Gemini AI to generate images of people, following widespread complaints of historical inaccuracies and bias.

title: Amazon's (AMZN) Zoox Self-Driving Taxis Begin Testing in Austin
description: Amazon's autonomous vehicle unit, Zoox, has deployed its robotaxis in Austin, Texas, for the first time, beginning tests in a new city.

title: NVIDIA (NVDA) Acquires French AI Audio Startup 'Voicely'
description: NVIDIA has acquired 'Voicely', a Parisian AI startup specializing in real-time voice and audio generation, for an undisclosed sum.

title: Tether (USDT) Freezes $50M in Assets Linked to Sanctioned Wallet
description: Tether, the issuer of the USDT stablecoin, has frozen $50 million in assets following a request from the U.S. Treasury Department's OFAC.

title: Apple (AAPL) Cuts Vision Pro Production Targets Again
description: Citing lower-than-expected demand and manufacturing complexity, Apple (AAPL) has reportedly cut its 2026 production forecast for the Vision Pro headset by 30%.

title: Fed's Williams: 'No Urgency to Cut Rates'
description: New York Fed President John Williams stated there is 'no urgency' to cut interest rates, as inflation remains stubbornly above the 2% target. Markets (SPY) fell slightly.

title: Adobe (ADBE) Abandons $20B Figma Acquisition Amid Regulatory Pressure
description: Adobe and Figma have mutually agreed to terminate their $20 billion merger agreement, citing 'no clear path' to regulatory approval from the UK's CMA and the DOJ.

title: Google (GOOGL) Invests $2B in AI Startup Anthropic
description: Google has invested another $2 billion into AI safety and research startup Anthropic, deepening its partnership to compete with OpenAI.

title: Instagram (META) Rolls Out AI-Powered 'Smart Filters' for DMs
description: Instagram is launching new 'Smart Filters' that use AI to automatically sort incoming DMs, moving spam, scams, and unsolicited content out of the main inbox.

title: Rivian (RIVN) Stock Soars 15% on Volkswagen (VWAGY) Partnership
description: Shares of EV maker Rivian (RIVN) surged 15% after announcing a joint venture with Volkswagen to share EV architecture and software, a major boost for the struggling startup.

title: Netflix (NFLX) Enters Animated Film Space with $1B DreamWorks Deal
description: Netflix has signed a $1 billion, 5-year deal with DreamWorks Animation to exclusively produce original animated films for the streaming platform.

title: US Pending Home Sales Fall to Record Low
description: The index for pending home sales, a leading indicator for the housing market, fell 5% in October to its lowest level since data collection began in 2001.

title: Arbitrum (ARB) Network Halted for 3 Hours Due to Sequencer Bug
description: The Arbitrum Layer 2 network experienced a 3-hour outage after its main sequencer stalled, an issue the team attributed to a 'critical bug' that has since been patched.

title: Google (GOOGL) Delays Pixel 10 Launch, Citing In-House 'Tensor 5' Chip Delays
description: Reports suggest Google is delaying the launch of its Pixel 10 smartphone until early 2026, due to difficulties in manufacturing its first fully custom 'Tensor 5' processor.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) to Offer AI-Powered 'Windows 12' as Subscription
description: Microsoft is reportedly planning to offer 'Windows 12', its next-gen AI-integrated OS, as a monthly subscription service for premium features.

title: Amazon (AMZN) Ordered to Pay $1.5B in Fines for Labor Violations
description: A federal court has ordered Amazon to pay $1.5 billion in fines and back wages for systematically violating labor laws and suppressing union activity across multiple states.

title: PayPal Stock Rallies After Game-Changing Deal with OpenAI
description: PayPal (PYPL) shares surged 10.46% to $77.74 in premarket trading following a partnership with OpenAI to embed its digital wallet into ChatGPT...

title: MicroStrategy (MSTR) Buys An Additional 10,000 Bitcoin for $600M
description: MicroStrategy has purchased an additional 10,000 BTC for $600 million, bringing its total holdings to over 200,000 Bitcoin.

title: NVIDIA (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang to Keynote at CES 2026
description: The Consumer Technology Association (CTA) announced that NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang will deliver the opening keynote at CES 2026, focusing on AI in robotics and autonomous vehicles.

title: Apple (AAPL) Music Surpasses 110 Million Paid Subscribers
description: Apple announced its Apple Music service has crossed the 110 million paid subscriber milestone, though it still trails Spotify globally.

title: Ford (F) CEO Says EV Price War is 'Unsustainable'
description: Ford CEO Jim Farley stated that the ongoing EV price war, largely initiated by Tesla (TSLA), is 'unsustainable' for the industry and is crushing profit margins.

title: US National Debt Surpasses $37 Trillion for First Time
description: The U.S. national debt has officially crossed the $37 trillion mark, raising fresh concerns in Washington and on Wall Street about long-term fiscal sustainability.

title: AMD (AMD) Launches New 'Ryzen 9000X3D' Gaming Chips
description: AMD has released its new X3D line of gaming processors, the Ryzen 9 9950X3D and 9900X3D, featuring its 3D V-Cache technology for enhanced gaming performance.

title: Meta (META) to Begin Charging for 'WhatsApp Business Pro'
description: Meta is introducing a new 'WhatsApp Business Pro' tier, charging enterprises for advanced features like AI-powered customer service bots and large-scale marketing messages.

title: Amazon (AMZN) Q3 Profit Smashes Estimates on Cost-Cutting Measures
description: Amazon's Q3 net income tripled year-over-year, blowing past analyst estimates, as CEO Andy Jassy's aggressive cost-cutting and layoffs boost profitability.

title: SEC Chairman Gensler: 'Most Crypto Tokens are Securities'
description: In a congressional hearing, SEC Chair Gary Gensler reiterated his stance that 'the vast majority' of cryptocurrencies are unregistered securities and subject to SEC rules.

title: Netflix (NFLX) Stock Drops 7% on Disappointing Subscriber Forecast
description: Despite a Q3 earnings beat, Netflix (NFLX) shares are down 7% after the company provided a Q4 subscriber growth forecast that fell short of Wall Street expectations.

title: Google (GOOGL) to Invest $1B in New UK Data Center
description: Google announced a $1 billion investment to build a new, energy-efficient data center outside of London to meet growing demand for AI and cloud services.

title: Tesla (TSLA) to Open Supercharger Network to Ford and GM EVs
description: Tesla has finalized agreements to open over 12,000 of its Superchargers to Ford (F) and GM (GM) electric vehicles in North America starting early next year.

title: Apple (AAPL) Reportedly Working on 'AI-Powered' AirPods
description: A new report claims Apple is developing new AirPods models that integrate AI to provide real-time language translation and health monitoring features.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Closes $69B Acquisition of Activision Blizzard
description: After two years of regulatory battles, Microsoft has officially closed its $69 billion acquisition of video game publisher Activision Blizzard (ATVI).

title: US Core PCE Inflation Rises 0.3% in October, In Line with Estimates
description: The Core Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) price index, the Fed's preferred inflation gauge, rose 0.3% month-over-month, meeting economist expectations.

title: NVIDIA (NVDA) and Foxconn Announce 'AI Factory' Partnership
description: NVIDIA is partnering with Foxconn to build 'AI factories', deploying NVIDIA's complete hardware and software stack to modernize Foxconn's manufacturing plants.

title: Amazon (AMZN) to Launch Luxury Fashion Store 'Amazon Vogue'
description: Amazon is partnering with luxury brands to launch 'Amazon Vogue', a new, separate online storefront for high-end fashion, competing with Farfetch and Yoox.

title: Google (GOOGL) Sued by DoJ Over Digital Advertising 'Monopoly'
description: The U.S. Department of Justice has filed a landmark antitrust lawsuit against Google, seeking to break up its dominant digital advertising business.

title: Binance CEO 'CZ' Steps Down, Pleads Guilty to US Criminal Charges
description: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao ('CZ') has stepped down and pleaded guilty to U.S. anti-money laundering violations. Binance will pay a $4.3 billion fine.

title: Meta (META) Unveils 'Ray-Ban Stories 2' with Live-Streaming and AI
description: Meta and Ray-Ban launched the next generation of their smart glasses, which now feature live-streaming to Instagram and an on-board AI assistant.

title: Uber (UBER) Q3 Earnings Miss, Stock Falls 7% on Weak Ride-Hailing Forecast
description: Uber (UBER) reported Q3 earnings that missed analyst expectations, with a weaker-than-expected forecast for its core ride-hailing business, sending shares down 7%.

title: US 10-Year Treasury Yield Tops 5.0% for First Time Since 2007
description: The yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury note briefly surpassed 5.0%, a new multi-decade high, as investors brace for 'higher for longer' interest rates.

title: Tesla (TSLA) Cybertruck Deliveries Surpass 10,000 Units
description: Tesla announced it has successfully delivered its 10,000th Cybertruck, a key production milestone for the difficult-to-manufacture vehicle.

title: Satya Nadella Sells $100M in Microsoft (MSFT) Stock
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella sold approximately $100 million worth of MSFT stock, according to a recent SEC filing, as part of a pre-arranged trading plan.

title: Apple (AAPL) Unveils 'Final Cut Pro for Vision Pro'
description: Apple launched a new, spatially-aware version of its video editing software, 'Final Cut Pro for Vision Pro', allowing for immersive 3D video editing.

title: China's Top Firms Develop New AI Chips to Bypass US Sanctions
description: Chinese tech giants, including Huawei and Tencent, are reportedly making progress on new AI accelerators designed to work around US export controls on NVIDIA (NVDA) GPUs.

title: Intel (INTC) to Spin Off its Programmable Solutions Group (PSG)
description: Intel announced plans to spin off its Programmable Solutions Group (formerly Altera) into a separate, publicly traded company to unlock shareholder value.

title: YouTube (GOOGL) Launches AI-Powered 'Dream Screen' for Creators
description: YouTube is rolling out 'Dream Screen', a new generative AI tool that allows creators to generate AI video or image backgrounds for their Shorts just by typing a prompt.

title: AMD (AMD) Data Center Revenue Grows 150% Year-Over-Year
description: AMD reported strong Q3 earnings, with its data center segment revenue growing 150% YoY, driven by strong sales of its MI300-series AI chips.

title: Consensys (MetaMask) Raises $500M at $10B Valuation
description: Consensys, the parent company of the popular Ethereum wallet MetaMask, has raised $500 million in a new funding round led by a16z, valuing the company at $10 billion.

title: Netflix's 'Squid Game: The Challenge' Becomes #1 Show Globally
description: Netflix's (NFLX) reality competition spin-off, 'Squid Game: The Challenge', has become its #1 most-watched show in 87 countries, the company announced.

title: Amazon (AMZN) Pauses Warehouse Construction Amid Slowing Sales
description: Amazon is halting construction on several new fulfillment centers in the US as it pivots from rapid expansion to cost-cutting amid slowing e-commerce growth.

title: US Job Openings (JOLTS) Fall to 2-Year Low
description: The number of job openings in the US fell to 8.8 million, the lowest level in two years, signaling that the tight labor market is finally loosening.

title: Microsoft Teams 2.0, Rebuilt for Speed, Rolls Out Globally
description: Microsoft (MSFT) announced the new version of Teams, which has been rebuilt from the ground up to be twice as fast and use 50% less memory, is now available to all users.

title: Nio (NIO) Partners with Tesla (TSLA) on Charging Network in China
description: Chinese EV maker Nio (NIO) has signed an agreement with Tesla (TSLA) to integrate its charging network, allowing Nio users to access Tesla's Superchargers in China.

title: Meta Quest 3 Sales Hit 3 Million Units in First Quarter
description: Meta (META) has sold over 3 million Quest 3 headsets in its first quarter, according to supply chain reports, outpacing the launch of the Quest 2.

title: iPhone 17 to Feature Under-Display Camera, Analyst Claims
description: Reliable analyst Ming-Chi Kuo claims the 2026 'iPhone 17 Pro' (AAPL) will be the first to feature an under-display front-facing camera, eliminating the Dynamic Island.

title: Spot Bitcoin ETFs See $1B in AUM in First Week of Trading
description: The newly launched spot Bitcoin (BTCUSD) ETFs have collectively seen over $1 billion in assets under management (AUM) in their first week of trading.

title: Google Search Market Share Dips Below 90% for First Time
description: Data from StatCounter shows Google's (GOOGL) global search market share has dropped to 89.9%, the first time it has fallen below 90% in over a decade.

title: NVIDIA (NVDA) Market Cap Surpasses $4 Trillion
description: NVIDIA (NVDA) has become the first semiconductor company to reach a $4 trillion market capitalization, driven by continued dominance in the AI chip market.

title: US Q3 GDP Revised Up to 3.2% from 3.0%
description: The Bureau of Economic Analysis's second estimate for Q3 GDP showed the US economy grew at a 3.2% annualized rate, revised up from the 3.0% advance estimate.
